intro: Dichotophyllum, commonly known as the two-lobed plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Cucurbitaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive two-lobed leaves and tendrils that aid in climbing. The flowers are typically unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant. The fruit is a berry that contains several seeds. Dichotophyllum is native to various regions in Africa and is often found in tropical and subtropical environments.
